name: DIMITRIOS K >>RMXS<< LP
description:
OUT NOW!

Dimitrios K is a legendary techno dj from Gothenburg, Sweden. iDEAL released his untitled debut album last year, filled with his deep techno. Now we are releasing his new LP, based upon a few of these tracks, remixed by no less than some of the top names of Swedish techno; VAN RIVERS, DUNGEON ACID, JOEL ALTER and SAMUEL L SESSION. We're making 250 of this on high quality black vinyl, played at 33 rpm. It's mastered by Samuel L Session in Berlin. Top stuff, man.

<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F107647836"></iframe>

name: SEWER ELECTION FREDERIKKE HOFFMEIER >>ASKA<< LP
description:
AVAILABLE NOW!!!

The vinyl Long Player "Aska" is a deep collaboration by Swedish west coast noise master Dan Johansson of SEWER ELECTION and Copenhagen's queen of filth Frederikke Hoffmeier (also infamous as Puce Mary of the Posh Isolation fame). 

Static, beautiful, crude experimental electro-acoustic noise, no hope, no love. Limited to 250 copies. Black vinyl. 

For order of multiple items - postage will be lower: Please contact: consume@belaten.se

name: KEVIN DRUMM >>PURGE<< CD
description:
AVAILABLE NOW!

Kevin Drumm's 2007 cassette "PURGE" on iDEAL went out of stock in less than a week. This is the CD version of that killer thing. Intense listening taking you deep into the known unknown, or perhaps the unknown known. Drumm's noise is extremely powerful and dynamic.; travelling frequencies, rich with details, with very little hope, with guaranteed exhaustion after frequent listening.

Edition of 500 copies.

For order of multiple items - postage will be lower: Please contact: consume@belaten.se

name: CARL MICHAEL VON HAUSSWOLFF >>MATTER TRANSFER<< LP
description:
Limited to 300 copies. Hand numbered.

All tracks composed at The Castle, 2006, and pre-mastered at La Hacienda, 2008, by Carl Michael von Hausswolff.
 
Recorded at Färgfabriken Center for Contemporary Art and Architecture, Stockholm, Sweden, in connection with the exhibition Matter! by Carl Michael von Hausswolff (12-channel audio composition) and Anita Gordh (visuals), 2006, curated by Jan Åman.
 
Matter Transfer (model 4 and 5) was installed 2009 in Stavanger, Norway, within the series Enter: Sonic Tank, Tou Scene, curated by Anne Hilde Neset.

In addition:
• No Rest Even for the Static (Matter II) - a 47-channel composition - was installed and premiered 2010 in Istanbul, Turkey, as a part of the second installation of The Morning Line by Matthew Ritchie with Aranda/Lasch and Arup AGU organized by Thyssen-Bornemisza Art Contemporary and curated by Russell Haswell.
• Matter III - an 8-channel composition - was installed 2011 at MuseumsQuartier in Vienna, Austria, as a part of the series Tonspurcurated by Georg Weckwerth.
 
Matter is a part of the Moderna Museet collection in Stockholm.
Matter II is a part of the Thyssen-Bornemisza Art Contemporary collection in Vienna.

Special thanks and photographic credits: Maria von Hausswolff, Erik Pauser, Leif Elggren, Marietta von Hausswolff von Baumgarten, Lauri Dammert, Michaela von Hausswolff, Ulrich Hillebrand, Udo Breger, Kai Bro Sørensen, Catarina von Baumgarten, Kari Jantzen, Thomas Nordanstad, Annika von Hausswolff, Hrvoje Goluza and other unidentified persons.
 
Thanks to Jan Åman and Jari Lehtinen.

Portrait photo på Erik Lee Snyder, Brooklyn 2011. Hausswollf photos organized by Lisa Nordwall. Cover by Nullvoid.

Executive producer: Joachim Nordwall.

For order of multiple items - postage will be lower: Please contact: consume@belaten.se

description:

side one:

name: RUSSELL HASWELL >>"SCANDINAVIAN PARTS (IMMERSIVE LIVE SALVAGE SUPPLEMENT)"<< CD
description:
"Noise with purpose, lean and economical, and tremendously exciting." - The WIRE.

iDEAL099
RUSSELL HASWELL "SCANDINAVIAN PARTS (IMMERSIVE LIVE SALVAGE SUPPLEMENT)" 
CD Album. Digipack. Release: May 2012. No barcode.

Track list: 
01 Copenhagen, April 2, 2010, Part 1 (UHJ)
02 Copenhagen, April 2, 2010, Part 2 (UHJ)
03 Copenhagen, April 2, 2010, Part 3 (UHJ)
04 Oslo, April 3, 2010, Part 1 (UHJ)
05 Oslo, April 3, 2010, Part 2 (UHJ)
06 Oslo, April 3, 2010, Part 3 (UHJ)
07 Oslo, April 3, 2010, Part 4 (UHJ)
08 Gothenburg, April 4, 2010, Part 1 (UHJ)
09 Gothenburg, April 4, 2010, Part 2 (UHJ)
10 Encore from Gothenburg, April 4, 2010 (UHJ)
11 Aarhus, April 5, 2010, Part 1 (UHJ)
12 Aarhus, April 5, 2010, Part 2 (UHJ)
13 Aarhus, April 5, 2010, Part 3 (UHJ)
14 Aarhus, April 5, 2010, Part 4 (UHJ)
15 Aarhus, April 5, 2010, Part 5 (UHJ)

The size of the stage, position of the equipment, monitor position and height, hall architecture and acoustics, capacity and attendance, temperature and humidity, and sound level (dB) or Leq Meter limiting all varied from event to event. Each of the final recordings documents the performed audio output, each hall’s acoustics, the audience’s reaction, and their proximity to the recorder, all from an onstage position, while retaining the auditorium’s spatial impression. Recordings failed, or didn’t take place on 9 occasions. 

(November 16, 2010) 
(Slightly Revised: December 2, 2010)

No edits, No crossfades.

Performed + Recorded + Produced + Compiled  + Mastered by Russell Haswell.

Thanks: Sean, Rob, Glyn, Rob, Mark, Jamie, Lloyd, Tony Myatt & Dave Malham + the Lads (YORK mrc), Richard Elen, Amanda, Joachim (iDEAL), Peter (eMego), Andreas, Anna, Mats (EMS Stockholm), THE HAFLER TRIO... 

http://idealrecordings.com/
http://haswellstudio.com/

© Russell Haswell & iDEAL 2012.

"Definitely not recommended for fans of Deadmau5 or Swedish House Mafia. " - BOOMKAT.

name: EVIL MOISTURE >>IF YOU WANT TO FUCK THE SKY, TEACH YOUR COCK TO FLY<< LP
description: Intense trip by Evil Moisture. Analogue treatments, Brigitte Bordelle screaming her skull off, all there to make you as uncomfortable as possible. Highly recommended!
